Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:52: "It will be on a Day when He will call you, and ye will answer (His call) with (words of) His praise, and ye will think that ye tarried but a little while!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:53: Say to My servants that they should (only) say those things that are best: for Satan doth sow dissensions among them: For Satan is to man an avowed enemy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:54: It is your Lord that knoweth you best: If He please, He granteth you mercy, or if He please, punishment: We have not sent thee to be a disposer of their affairs for them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:55: And it is your Lord that knoweth best all beings that are in the heavens and on earth: We did bestow on some prophets more (and other) gifts than on others: and We gave to David (the gift of) the Psalms.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:56: : "Call on those - besides Him - whom ye fancy: they have neither the power to remove your troubles from you nor to change them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:57: Those whom they call upon do desire (for themselves) means of access to their Lord, - even those who are nearest: they hope for His Mercy and fear His Wrath: for the Wrath of thy Lord is something to take heed of.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:58: There is not a population but We shall destroy it before the Day of Judgment or punish it with a dreadful Penalty: that is written in the (eternal) Record.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:59: And We refrain from sending the signs, only because the men of former generations treated them as false: We sent the she-camel to the Thamud to open their eyes, but they treated her wrongfully: We only send the Signs by way of terror (and warning from evil).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:60: Behold! We told thee that thy Lord doth encompass mankind round about: We granted the vision which We showed thee, but as a trial for men,- as also the Cursed Tree (mentioned) in the Qur’an: We put terror (and warning) into them, but it only increases their inordinate transgression!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:61: Behold! We said to the angels: "Bow down unto Adam": They bowed down except Iblis: He said, "Shall I bow down to one whom Thou didst create from clay?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:62: He said: "Seest Thou? this is the one whom Thou hast honoured above me! If Thou wilt but respite me to the Day of Judgment, I will surely bring his descendants under my sway - all but a few!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:63: (God) said: "Go thy way; if any of them follow thee, verily Hell will be the recompense of you (all)- an ample recompense.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:64: "Lead to destruction those whom thou canst among them, with thy (seductive) voice; make assaults on them with thy cavalry and thy infantry; mutually share with them wealth and children; and make promises to them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:65: "As for My servants, no authority shalt thou have over them:" Enough is thy Lord for a Disposer of affairs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:66: Your Lord is He That maketh the Ship go smoothly for you through the sea, in order that ye may seek of his Bounty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:67: When distress seizes you at sea, those that ye call upon - besides Himself - leave you in the lurch! but when He brings you back safe to land, ye turn away (from Him).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:68: Do ye then feel secure that He will not cause you to be swallowed up beneath the earth when ye are on land, or that He will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones) so that ye shall find no one to carry out your affairs for you?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:69: Or do ye feel secure that He will not send you back a second time to sea and send against you a heavy gale to drown you because of your ingratitude, so that ye find no helper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:70: We have honoured the sons of Adam; provided them with transport on land and sea; given them for sustenance things good and pure; and conferred on them special favours, above a great part of our creation.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:71: One day We shall call together all human beings with their (respective) Imams: those who are given their record in their right hand will read it (with pleasure), and they will not be dealt with unjustly in the least.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:72: But those who were blind in this world, will be blind in the hereafter, and most astray from the Path.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:73: And their purpose was to tempt thee away from that which We had revealed unto thee, to substitute in our name something quite different; (in that case), behold! they would certainly have made thee (their) friend!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:74: And had We not given thee strength, thou wouldst nearly have inclined to them a little.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:75: In that case We should have made thee taste an equal portion (of punishment) in this life, and an equal portion in death: and moreover thou wouldst have found none to help thee against Us!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:76: Their purpose was to scare thee off the land, in order to expel thee; but in that case they would not have stayed (therein) after thee, except for a little while.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:77: (This was Our) way with the apostles We sent before thee: thou wilt find no change in Our ways.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:78: Establish regular prayers - at the sun’s decline till the darkness of the night, and the morning prayer and reading: for the prayer and reading in the morning carry their testimony.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:79: And pray in the small watches of the morning: (it would be) an additional prayer (or spiritual profit) for thee: soon will thy Lord raise thee to a Station of Praise and Glory!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:80: Say: "O my Lord! Let my entry be by the Gate of Truth and Honour, and likewise my exit by the Gate of Truth and Honour; and grant me from Thy Presence an authority to aid (me).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:81: And say: "Truth has (now) arrived, and Falsehood perished: for Falsehood is (by its nature) bound to perish.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:82: We send down (stage by stage) in the Qur’an that which is a healing and a mercy to those who believe: to the unjust it causes nothing but loss after loss.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:83: Yet when We bestow Our favours on man, he turns away and becomes remote on his side (instead of coming to Us), and when evil seizes him he gives himself up to despair!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:84: Say: "Everyone acts according to his own disposition: But your Lord knows best who it is that is best guided on the Way.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:85: They ask thee concerning the Spirit (of inspiration).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:86: If it were Our Will, We could take away that which We have sent thee by inspiration:then wouldst thou find none to plead thy affair in that matter as against Us,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:87: Except for Mercy from thy Lord: for his bounty is to thee (indeed) great.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:88: Say: "If the whole of mankind and Jinns were to gather together to produce the like of this Qur’an, they could not produce the like thereof, even if they backed up each other with help and support.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:89: And We have explained to man, in this Qur’an, every kind of similitude: yet the greater part of men refuse (to receive it) except with ingratitude!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:90: They say: "We shall not believe in thee, until thou cause a spring to gush forth for us from the earth,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:91: "Or (until) thou have a garden of date trees and vines, and cause rivers to gush forth in their midst, carrying abundant water;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:92: "Or thou cause the sky to fall in pieces, as thou sayest (will happen), against us; or thou bring God and the angels before (us) face to face:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:93: "Or thou have a house adorned with gold, or thou mount a ladder right into the skies.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:94: What kept men back from belief when Guidance came to them, was nothing but this: they said, "Has God sent a man (like us) to be (His) Apostle?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:95: Say, "If there were settled, on earth, angels walking about in peace and quiet, We should certainly have sent them down from the heavens an angel for an apostle.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:96: Say: "Enough is God for a witness between me and you: for He is well acquainted with His servants, and He sees (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:97: It is he whom God guides, that is on true Guidance; but he whom He leaves astray - for such wilt thou find no protector besides Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:98: That is their recompense, because they rejected Our signs, and said, "When we are reduced to bones and broken dust, should we really be raised up (to be) a new Creation?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:99: See they not that God, Who created the heavens and the earth, has power to create the like of them (anew)? Only He has decreed a term appointed, of which there is no doubt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:100: Say: "If ye had control of the Treasures of the Mercy of my Lord, behold, ye would keep them back, for fear of spending them: for man is (every) niggardly!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:101: To Moses We did give Nine Clear Sings: As the Children of Israel: when he came to them, Pharaoh said to him: "O Moses! I consider thee, indeed, to have been worked upon by sorcery!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:102: Moses said, "Thou knowest well that these things have been sent down by none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth as eye-opening evidence: and I consider thee indeed, O Pharaoh, to be one doomed to destruction!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:103: So he resolved to remove them from the face of the earth: but We did drown him and all who were with him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:104: And We said thereafter to the Children of Israel, "Dwell securely in the land (of promise)": but when the second of the warnings came to pass, We gathered you together in a mingled crowd.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:105: We sent down the (Qur’an) in Truth, and in Truth has it descended: and We sent thee but to give Glad Tidings and to warn (sinners).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:106: (It is) a Qur’an which We have divided (into parts from time to time), in order that thou mightest recite it to men at intervals: We have revealed it by stages.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:107: Say: "Whether ye believe in it or not, it is true that those who were given knowledge beforehand, when it is recited to them, fall down on their faces in humble prostration,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:108: "And they say: ’Glory to our Lord! Truly has the promise of our Lord been fulfilled!’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:109: They fall down on their faces in tears, and it increases their (earnest) humility.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:110: Say: "Call upon God, or call upon Rahman: by whatever name ye call upon Him, (it is well): for to Him belong the Most Beautiful Names.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 17:111: Say: "Praise be to God, who begets no son, and has no partner in (His) dominion: Nor (needs) He any to protect Him from humiliation: yea, magnify Him for His greatness and glory!"

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:1: Glory be to Him, who carried His servant by night from the Holy Mosque to the Further Mosque the precincts of which We have blessed, that We might show him some of Our signs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:2: And We gave Moses the Book, and made it a guidance to the Children of Israel: ’Take not unto yourselves any guardian apart from Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:3: The seed of those We bore with Noah; he was a thankful servant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:4: And We decreed for the Children of Israel in the Book: ’You shall do corruption in the earth twice, and you shall ascend exceeding high.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:5: So, when the promise of the first of these came to pass, We sent against you servants of Ours, men of great might, and they went through the habitations, and it was a promise performed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:6: Then We gave back to you the turn to prevail over them, and We succoured you with wealth and children, and We made you a greater host.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:7: ’If you do good, it is your own souls you do good to, and if you do evil it is to them likewise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:8: Perchance your Lord will have mercy upon you; but if you return, We shall return; and We have made Gehenna a prison for the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:9: Surely this Koran guides to the way that is straightest and gives good tidings to the believers who do deeds of righteousness, that theirs shall be a great wage,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:10: and that those who do not believe in the world to come -- we have prepared for them a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:11: Man prays for evil, as he prays for good; man is ever hasty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:12: We have appointed the night and the day as two signs; then We have blotted out the sign of the night, and made the sign of the day to see, and that you may seek bounty from your Lord, and that you may know the number of the years, and the reckoning; and everything We have distinguished very distinctly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:13: And every man -- We have fastened to him his bird of omen upon his neck; and We shall bring forth for him, on the Day of Resurrection, a book he shall find spread wide open.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:14: ’Read thy book! Thy soul suffices thee this day as a reckoner against thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:15: Whosoever is guided, is only guided to his own gain, and whosoever goes astray, it is only to his own loss; no soul laden bears the load of another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:16: And when We desire to destroy a city, We command its men who live at ease, and they commit ungodliness therein, then the Word is realized against it, and We destroy it utterly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:17: How many generations We have destroyed after Noah! Thy Lord suffices as one who is aware of and sees the sins of His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:18: Whosoever desires this hasty world, We hasten for him therein what We will unto whomsoever We desire; then We appoint for him Gehenna wherein he shall roast, condemned and rejected.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:19: And whosoever desires the world to come and strives after it as he should, being a believer -- those, their striving shall be thanked.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:20: Each We succour, these and those, from thy Lord’s gift; and thy Lord’s gift is not confined.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:21: Behold, how We prefer some of them over others! And surely the world to come is greater in ranks, greater in preferment.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:22: Set not up with God another god, or thou wilt sit condemned and forsaken.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:23: Thy Lord has decreed you shall not serve any but Him, and to be good to parents, whether one or both of them attains old age with thee; say not to them ’Fie’ neither chide them, but speak unto them words respectful,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:24: and lower to them the wing of humbleness out of mercy and say; ’My Lord, have mercy upon them, as they raised me up when I was little.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:25: Your Lord knows very well what is in your hearts if you are righteous, for He is All-forgiving to those who are penitent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:26: And give the kinsman his right, and the needy, and the traveller; and never squander;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:27: the squanderers are brothers of Satan, and Satan is unthankful to his Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:28: But if thou turnest from them, seeking mercy from thy Lord that thou hopest for, then speak unto them gentle words.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:29: And keep not thy hand chained to thy neck, nor outspread it widespread altogether, or thou wilt sit reproached and denuded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:30: Surely thy Lord outspreads and straitens His provision unto whom He will; surely He is aware of and sees His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:31: And slay not your children for fear of poverty; We will provide for you and them; surely the slaying of them is a grievous sin.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:32: And approach not fornication; surely it is an indecency, and evil as a way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:33: And slay not the soul God has forbidden, except by right.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:34: And do not approach the property of the orphan save in the fairest manner, until he is of age.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:35: And fill up the measure when you measure, and weigh with the straight balance; that is better and fairer in the issue.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:36: And pursue not that thou hast no knowledge of; the hearing, the sight, the heart -- all of those shall be questioned of.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:37: And walk not in the earth exultantly; certainly thou wilt never tear the earth open, nor attain the mountains in height.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:38: All of that -- the wickedness of it is hateful in the sight of thy Lord has revealed to thee:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:39: That is of the wisdom thy Lord set not up with God another god, or thou wilt be cast into Gehenna, reproached and rejected.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:40: What, has your Lord favoured you with sons and taken to Himself from the angels females? Surely it is a monstrous thing you are saying!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:41: We have turned about in this Koran, that they may remember; and it increases them only in aversion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:42: Say: ’If there had been other gods with Him, as they say, in that case assuredly they would have sought a way unto the Lord of the Throne.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:43: High indeed be He exalted above that they say!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:44: The seven heavens and the earth, and whosoever in them is, extol Him; nothing is, that does not proclaim His praise, but you do not understand their extolling.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:45: When thou recitest the Koran, We place between thee, and those who do not believe in the world to come, a curtain obstructing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:46: and We lay veils upon their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears heaviness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:47: We know very well how they listen when they listen to thee, and when they conspire, when the evildoers say, ’You are only following a man bewitched!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:48: Behold, how they strike similitudes for thee, and go astray, and cannot find a way!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:49: They say, ’What, when we are bones and broken bits, shall we really be raised up again in a new creation?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:50: Say: ’Let you be stones, or iron,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:51: or some creation yet more monstrous in your minds!’ Then they will say, ’Who will bring us back?’ Say: ’He who originated you the first time.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:52: on the day when He will call you, and you will answer praising Him, and you will think you have but tarried a little.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:53: And say to My servants, that they say words that are kindlier.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:54: Your Lord knows you very well; if He will, He will have mercy on you, or, if He will, He will chastise you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:55: And thy Lord knows very well all who are in the heavens and the earth; and We have preferred some Prophets over others; and We gave to David Psalms.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:56: Say: ’Call on those you asserted apart from Him; they have no power to remove affliction from you, or to transfer it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:57: Those they call upon are themselves seeking the means to come to their Lord, which of them shall be nearer; they hope for His mercy, and fear His chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:58: No city is there, but We shall destroy it before the Day of Resurrection, or We shall chastise it with a terrible chastisement; that is in the Book inscribed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:59: Naught prevented Us from sending the signs but that the ancients cried lies to them; and We brought Thamood the She-camel visible, but they did her wrong.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:60: And when We said to thee, ’Surely thy Lord encompasses men,’ and We made the vision that We showed thee and the tree cursed in the Koran to be only a trial for men; and We frighten them, but it only increases them in great insolence.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:61: And when We said to the angels, ’Bow yourselves to Adam’; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he said,, ’Shall I bow myself unto one Thou hast created of clay?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:62: He said, ’What thinkest Thou? This whom Thou hast honoured above me -- if Thou deferrest me to the Day of Resurrection I shall assuredly master his seed, save a few.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:63: Said He, ’Depart! Those of them that follow thee -- surely Gehenna shall be your recompense, an ample recompense!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:64: And startle whomsoever of them thou canst with thy voice; and rally against them thy horsemen and thy foot, and share with them in their wealth and their children, and promise them!’ But Satan promises them naught, except delusion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:65: ’Surely over My servants thou shalt have no authority.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:66: Your Lord it is who drives for you the ships on the sea that you may seek His bounty; surely He is All-compassionate towards you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:67: And when affliction visits you upon the sea, then there go astray those on whom you call except Him; and when He delivers you to land, you turn away; man is ever unthankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:68: Do you feel secure that He will not cause the shore to swallow you up, or loose against you a squall of pebbles, then you will find no guardian for you?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:69: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into it a second time, and loose against you a hurricane of wind and drown you for your thanklessness, then you will find no prosecutor for you against Us?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:70: We have honoured the Children of Adam and carried them on land and sea, and provided them with good things, and preferred them greatly over many of those We created.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:71: On the day when We shall call all men with their record, and whoso is given his book in his right hand -- those shall read their book, and they shall not be wronged a single date-thread.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:72: And whosoever is blind in this world shall be blind in the world to come, and he shall be even further astray from the way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:73: Indeed they were near to seducing thee from that We revealed to thee, that thou mightest forge against Us another, and then they would surely have taken thee as a friend;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:74: and had We not confirmed thee, surely thou wert near to inclining unto them a very little;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:75: then would We have let thee taste the double of life and the double of death; and then thou wouldst have found none to help thee against Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:76: Indeed they were near to startling thee from the land, to expel thee from it, and then they would have tarried after thee only a little --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:77: the wont of those We sent before thee of Our Messengers; thou wilt find no change to Our wont.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:78: Perform the prayer at the sinking of the sun to the darkening of the night and the recital of dawn; surely the recital of dawn is witnessed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:79: And as for the night, keep vigil a part of it, as a work of supererogation for thee; it may be that thy Lord will raise thee up to a laudable station.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:80: And say: ’My Lord, lead me in with a just ingoing, and lead me out with a just outgoing; grant me authority from Thee, to help me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:81: And say: ’The truth has come, and falsehood has vanished away; surely falsehood is ever certain to vanish.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:82: And We send down, of the Koran, that which is a healing and a mercy to the believers; and the unbelievers it increases not, except in loss.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:83: And when We bless man, he turns away, and withdraws aside; but when evil visits him, he is in despair.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:84: Say: ’Every man works according to his own manner; but your Lord knows very well what man is best guided as to the way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:85: They will question thee concerning the Spirit.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:86: If We willed, We could take away that We have revealed to thee, then thou wouldst find none thereover to guard thee against Us,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:87: excepting by some mercy of thy Lord; surly His favour to thee is great.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:88: Say: ’If men and jinn banded together to produce the like of this Koran, they would never produce its like, not though they backed one another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:89: We have indeed turned about for men in this Koran every manner of similitude; yet most men refuse all but unbelief.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:90: They say, ’We will not believe thee till thou makest a spring to gush forth from the earth for us,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:91: or till thou possessest a garden of plants and vines, and thou makest rivers to gush forth abundantly all amongst it,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:92: or till thou makest heaven to fall, as thou assertest, on us in fragments, or thou bringest God and the angels as a surety,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:93: or till thou possessest a house of gold ornament, or till thou goest up into heaven; and we will not believe thy going up till thou bringest down on us a book that we may read.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:94: And naught prevented men from believing when the guidance came to them, but that they said, ’Has God sent forth a mortal as Messenger?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:95: Say: ’Had there been in the earth angels walking.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:96: Say: ’God suffices as a witness between me and you; surely He is aware of and sees His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:97: Whomsoever God guides, he is rightly guided; and whom He leads astray -- thou wilt not find for them protectors, apart from Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:98: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our signs and said, ’What, when we are bones and broken bits, shall we really be raised up again in a new creation?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:99: Have they not seen that God, who created the heavens and earth, is powerful to create the like of them? He has appointed for them a term, no doubt of it; yet the unbelievers refuse all but unbelief.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:100: Say: ’If you possessed the treasuries of my Lord’s mercy, yet would you hold back for fear of expending; and man is ever niggardly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:101: And We gave Moses nine signs, clear signs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:102: He said, ’Indeed thou knowest that none sent these down, except the Lord of the heavens and earth, as clear proofs; and, Pharaoh, I think thou art accursed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:103: He desired to startle them from the land; and We drowned him and those with him, all together.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:104: And We said to the Children of Israel after him, ’Dwell in the land; and when the promise of the world to come comes to pass, We shall bring you a rabble.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:105: With the truth We have sent it down, and with the truth it has come down; and We have sent thee not, except good tidings to bear, and warning;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:106: and a Koran We have divided, for thee to recite it to mankind at intervals, and We have sent it down successively.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:107: Say: ’Believe in it, or believe not; those who were given the knowledge before it when it is recited to them, fall down upon their faces prostrating,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:108: and say, "Glory be to our Lord! Our Lord’s promise is performed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:109: And they fall down upon their faces weeping; and it increases them in humility.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:110: Say: ’Call upon God, or call upon the Merciful; whichsoever you call upon, to Him belong the Names Most Beautiful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 17:111: And say: ’Praise belongs to God, who has not taken to Him a son, and who has not any associate in the Kingdom, nor any protector out of humbleness.

Muhammad Asad.verse 17:1: LIMITLESS in His glory is He who transported His servant by night from the Inviolable House of Worship [at Mecca] to the Remote House of Worship [at Jerusalem] – the environs of which We had blessed – so that We might show him some of Our symbols: for, verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-seeing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:2: And [thus, too,] We vouchsafed revelation unto Moses, and made it a [source of] guidance for the children of Israel, [commanding them:] "Do not ascribe to any but Me the power to determine your fate,
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:3: O you descendants of those whom We caused to be borne [in the ark] with Noah! Behold, he was a most grateful servant [of Ours]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:5: known to the children of Israel through revelation: "Twice, indeed, will you spread corruption on earth and will indeed become grossly overbearing!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:6: Hence, when the prediction of the first of those two [periods of iniquity] came true, We sent against you some of Our bondmen of terrible prowess in war, and they wrought havoc throughout the land: and so the prediction was fulfilled.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:7: And after a time We allowed you to prevail against them once again, and aided you with wealth and offspring, and made you more numerous [than ever].
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:8: [And We said:] "If you persevere in doing good, you will but be doing good to yourselves; and if you do evil, it will be
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:10: Your Sustainer may well show mercy unto you; but if you revert [to sinning], We shall revert [to chastising you].
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:11: VERILY, this Qur’ān shows the way to all that is most upright, and gives the believers who do good deeds the glad tiding that theirs will be a great reward;
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:12: and [it announces, too,] that We have readied grievous suffering for those who will not believe in the life to come.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:14: prays for things that are bad as if he were praying for something that is good: for man is prone to be hasty [in his judgments].
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:15: And We have established the night and the day as two symbols; and thereupon We have effaced the symbol of night and set up [in its place] the light-giving symbol of day, so that you might seek to obtain your Sustainer’s bounty and be aware of the passing years and of the reckoning [that is bound to come].
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:16: And every human being’s destiny have We tied to his neck; and on the Day of Resurrection We shall bring forth for him a record which he will find wide open;
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:17: [and he will be told:] "Read this thy record! Sufficient is thine own self today to make out thine account!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:18: Whoever chooses to follow the right path, follows it but for his own good; and whoever goes astray, goes but astray to his own hurt; and no bearer of burdens shall be made to bear another’s burden.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:19: But when [this has been done, and] it is Our will to destroy a community, We convey Our last warning to those of its people who have lost themselves entirely in the pursuit of pleasures; and
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:20: they [continue to] act sinfully, the sentence [of doom] passed on the community takes effect, and We break it to smithereens.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:21: And how many a generation have We
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:22: destroyed after [the time of] Noah! For none has the like of thy Sustainer’s awareness and insight into His creatures’ sins.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:23: Unto him who cares for [no more than the enjoyment of] this fleeting life We readily grant thereof as much as We please,
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:24: to whomever it is Our will [to give]; but in the end We consign him to [the suffering of] hell, which he will have to endure disgraced and disowned!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:25: But as for those who care for the [good of the] life to come, and strive for it as it ought to be striven for, and are
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:26: believers withal – they are the ones whose striving finds favour [with God]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:27: All [of them] – these as well as those – do We freely endow with some of thy Sustainer’s gifts, since thy Sustainer’s giving is never confined [to one kind of man].
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:28: Behold how We bestow [on earth] more bounty on some of them than on others: but [remember that] the life to come will be far higher in degree and far greater in merit and bounty.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:29: DO NOT set up any other deity side by side with God, lest thou find thyself disgraced and forsaken:
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:30: for thy Sustainer has ordained that you shall worship none but Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:32: speak unto them with reverent speech,
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:33: and spread over them humbly the wings of thy tenderness, and say: "O my Sustainer! Bestow Thy grace upon them, even as they cherished and reared me when I was a child!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:34: Your Sustainer is fully aware of what is in your hearts.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:35: And give his due to the near of kin, as well as to the needy and the wayfarer, but do not squander [thy substance] senselessly.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:36: Behold, the squanderers are, indeed, of the ilk of the satans – inasmuch as Satan has indeed proved most ungrateful to his Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:38: turn aside from those [that are in want, because thou thyself art] seeking to obtain thy Sustainer’s grace and hoping for, at least speak unto them with gentle speech.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:39: And neither allow thy hand to remain shackled to thy neck, nor stretch it forth to the utmost limit [of thy capacity], lest thou find thyself blamed [by thy dependents], or even destitute.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:40: Behold, thy Sustainer grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure, unto whomever He wills: verily, fully aware is He of [the needs of] His creatures, and sees them all.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:41: Hence, do not kill your children for fear of poverty: it is We who shall provide sustenance for them as well as for you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:42: And do not commit adultery – for, behold, it is an abomination and an evil way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:43: And do not take any human being’s life – [the life] which God has willed to be sacred – otherwise than in [the pursuit of] justice.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:45: And do not touch the substance of an orphan, save to improve it, before he comes of age.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:46: And give full measure whenever you measure, and weigh with a balance that is true: this will be [for your own] good, and best in the end.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:47: And never concern thyself with anything of which thou hast no knowledge: verily,
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:48: hearing and sight and heart – all of them – will be called to account for it [on Judgment Day]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:49: And walk not on earth with haughty self-conceit: for, verily, thou canst never rend the earth asunder, nor canst thou ever grow as tall as the mountains!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:50: The evil of all this is odious in thy Sustainer’s sight:
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:51: this is part of that knowledge of right and wrong with which thy Sustainer has inspired thee.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:52: HAS, THEN, your Sustainer distinguished you by [giving you] sons, and taken unto Himself daughters in the guise of angels? Verily, you are uttering a dreadful saying!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:53: And, indeed, many facets have We given [to Our message] in this Qur’ān, so that they [who deny the truth] might take it to heart: but all this only increases their aversion.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:54: Say: "If there were – as some people assert –
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:55: deities side by side with Him, surely
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:56: they would have to strive to find a way unto Him who is enthroned on His almightiness?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:57: Limitless is He in His glory, and sublimely, immeasurably exalted above anything that men may say [about Him]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:58: The seven heavens extol His limitless glory, and the earth, and all that they contain; and there is not a single thing but extols His limitless glory and praise: but you [O men] fail to grasp the manner of their glorifying Him! Verily, He is forbearing, much-forgiving!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:59: But [thus it is:] whenever thou recitest the Qur’ān, We place an invisible barrier between thee and those who will not believe in the life to come:
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:60: for over their hearts We have laid veils which prevent them from grasping its purport, and into their ears, deafness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:61: We are fully aware of what they are listening for when they listen to thee: for when they are secluded among themselves, lo! these wrongdoers say [unto one another], "If you were to follow [Muhammad, you would follow] only a man bewitched!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:62: See to what they liken thee, [O Prophet, simply] because they have gone astray and are now unable to find a way [to the truth]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:63: And [thus, too,] they say, "After we will have become bones and dust, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead in a new act of creation?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:64: Say: "[You will be raised from the dead even though] you be stones or iron
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:66: substance which, to your minds, appears yet farther removed [from life]!"And
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:67: thereupon they ask, "Who is it that will bring us back [to life]?" – say thou: "He who has brought you into being in the first instance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:68: thereupon they shake their heads at thee [in disbelief] and ask, "When shall this be?" – say thou: "It may well be soon,
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:69: on a Day when He will call you, and you will answer by praising Him, thinking all the while that you have tarried [on earth] but a little while.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:70: AND TELL My servants that they should speak in the most kindly manner [unto those who do not share their beliefs]: verily, Satan is always ready to stir up discord between men – for, verily, Satan is man’s open foe!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:71: Your Sustainer is fully aware of what you are [and what you deserve]: if He so wills, he will bestow
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:72: grace upon you; and if He so wills, He will chastise you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:73: seeing that thy Sustainer is fully aware of [what is in the minds of] all beings that are in the heavens and on earth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:75: whom you imagine [to be endowed with divine powers] beside Him – and [you will find that] they have it not in their power to remove any affliction from you, or to shift it .
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:76: Those [saintly beings] whom they invoke are themselves striving to obtain their Sustainer’s favour –
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:77: those among them who are closest [to Him] – hoping for His grace and dreading His chastisement: for, verily, thy Sustainer’s chastisement is something to beware of!
Muhammad Asad.verse 17:78: And [bear in mind:] there is no community which We will not destroy before the Day of Resurrection, or chastise [even earlier, if it proves sinful,] with suffering severe: all this is laid down in Our decree.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:1: Glorious is He Who made his servant travel by night from Al-Masjid-ul-Harām to Al-Masjid-ul-AqSā whose environs We have blessed, so that We let him see some of Our signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:2: And We gave Mūsā the Book and made it guidance for the children of Isrā’īl (bearing the command) “Do not take anyone other than Me as guardian,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:3: O you, the progeny of those whom We put on board with NūH.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:4: And We declared to the children of Isrā’īl in the Book: “You will surely spread mischief on the earth twice, and you will surely show utmost haughtiness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:5: So, when came the time appointed for the first of the two, We dispatched against you some servants belonging to us having strong aggressive power, who combed through the houses; and it was a promise, bound to be fulfilled.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:6: Then We gave you your turn to overpower them, and increased your strength with wealth and sons, and made you greater in number,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:7: (saying) ‘If you do good, you will do it for your own benefit, and if you do evil, it will be against yourselves’.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:8: May be your Lord would bestow mercy upon you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:9: Surely, this Qur’ān guides to something that is most straightforward, and gives glad tidings to the believers who do good deeds that ready for them there is a great reward,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:10: and that We have prepared a painful punishment for those who do not believe in the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:11: Man prays for evil like his prayer for good, and man is so hasty.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:12: We have made the night and the day two signs, then We made the sign of night marked by darkness and the sign of day bright, so that you may seek grace from your Lord, and that you may know how to number the years and how to compute, and We have expounded everything in detail.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:13: We have tied up every human’s fortune to his neck, and on the Day of Resurrection, We will bring forth a book for him that he will find wide open,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:14: (and We will say to him) “Read your book.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:15: Whoever adopts the right path does so for his own benefit, and whoever goes astray does so to his own detriment, and no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of another, and it is not Our way to punish (anyone) unless We send a Messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:16: And when We intend to destroy a habitation, We command its affluent people (to do good), then they commit sins therein, and thus the word (of punishment) becomes applicable to it (habitation), and We annihilate it totally.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:17: How many a generation have We destroyed after NūH! And enough is your Lord to know, (and) watch the sins of His servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:18: Whoever opts for the immediate (benefits from) life herein, We give him, right here in this life, as much as We will, to whomever We intend.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:19: And whoever opts for the Hereafter and makes efforts for it as due, while he is a believer, then, the effort of such people is appreciated!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:20: To all of them - both these and those - We extend the grants of your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:21: See how We made some of them excel some others (in this world) and, of course, the Hereafter is much higher in ranks and much greater in degrees of merit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:22: Do not set up any other god along with Allah, otherwise you will sit condemned, forsaken.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:23: Your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him, and do good to parents.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:24: and submit yourself before them in humility out of compassion, and say, “My Lord, be merciful to them as they have brought me up in my childhood.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:25: Your Lord knows best what is in your hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:26: Give the relative his right, and the needy and the wayfarer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:27: Surely, squanderers are brothers of satans, and the Satan is very ungrateful to his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:28: And if you turn away from them looking for a bounty from your Lord you are expecting, then speak to them in polite words.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:29: And do not keep your hand tied to your neck, nor extend it to the full extent, lest you should be sitting reproached, empty-handed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:30: Indeed, your Lord expands sustenance for whomsoever He wills, and constricts (for whomsoever He wills).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:31: Do not kill your children for fear of poverty.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:32: Do not even go close to fornication.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:33: Do not kill any person the life of whom is sanctified by Allah, except for a just reason.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:34: Do not go near the property of an orphan, except in a manner that is good, until he comes to his maturity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:35: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with a straight balance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:36: And do not follow a thing about which you have no knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:37: Do not walk on the earth in haughty style.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:38: That which is evil, of all these, is detestable in the sight of your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:39: This is part of the Wisdom your Lord has revealed to you.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:41: Surely, We have explained things in various ways in this Qur’ān, so that they may pay heed to the advice; but it increases nothing in them except aversion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:42: Say, “Had there been other gods along with Him”, as they say, “then they would have found out a way to the Lord of the Throne”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:43: Pure is He, and Exalted, immensely above what they say.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:44: All the seven skies and the earth and all those therein extol His purity.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:46: and We put covers on their hearts barring them from understanding it, and (We put) deafness in their ears; and when you refer to your Lord alone (without referring to their presumed deities,) in the Qur’ān, they turn their backs in aversion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:47: We are fully aware of the reason for which they listen, when they listen to you, and when they are in secret consultation: when the transgressors say, “You are following none but a bewitched man.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:48: See how they have made (silly) statements about you; so they have gone astray and cannot find a way.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:53: Tell My servants that they should speak that which is best.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:71: (Think of) the Day when We will call every people with their books of deeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:72: But whoever is (too) blind in this (world to see the right path) will be (too) blind in the Hereafter (to reach the salvation), and much more astray from the path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:73: (O Prophet,) Surely, they were about to lure you away from what We have revealed to you, so that you forge something else against Us, and in that case they would have certainly made you a bosom friend.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:74: Had We not made you firm, it was likely that you would have inclined towards them a little bit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:75: In that case, We would have surely made you taste a double (punishment) in life and a double (punishment) after death, then you would not have found anyone to help you against Us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:76: And they were likely to harass you in the land, so that they could expel you from there, and in that case, they will have not lived (there) after you, but a little.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:77: Such has been Our way with the messengers We sent before you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:78: (O Prophet,) establish Salāh between the decline of the sun and the darkness of the night, and (establish) the recital at dawn.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:79: And during the night, wake up for Salāh of tahajjud , an additional prayer for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:80: And say, “O my Lord, make me enter a rightful entrance and make me exit a rightful exit, and grant me from Your Own a power, favored (by You).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:81: And say, “Truth has come and falsehood has vanished.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:82: We reveal the Qur’ān, which is cure and mercy for the believers; and it adds nothing to the unjust but loss.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:83: When We bestow Our favor upon man, he avoids (to recognize it) and keeps himself far aside (from obedience), and when some evil touches him, he is in total despair.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:84: Say, “Everyone acts in his own style.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:85: And they ask you about the soul.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:86: And if We so will, We will surely take away what We have revealed to you, then you shall find no one to rely upon against Us in this matter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:87: But it is a mercy from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:88: Say, “If all the humans and jinns join together to produce anything like this Qur’ān, they will not (be able to) come up with anything like it, even if they assist one another.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:89: Indeed We explained every subject in this Qur’ān in various ways for the benefit of mankind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:90: They said, “We shall never believe in you unless you cause a spring to gush forth for us from the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:91: Or you have a garden of date palms and grapes, then you bring forth rivers from their midst in abundance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:92: Or you cause the sky to fall upon us in pieces, as you claimed, or you bring Allah and angels before us face to face.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:93: Or you have a house made of gold.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:94: Nothing prevented people from believing, when guidance came to them, except that they said, “Has Allah sent a man as a messenger?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:95: Say, “Had there been angels (living) on the earth, walking about in peace, We would have certainly sent down an angel from the heavens as a messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:96: Say, “Allah is sufficient as witness between me and you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:97: The one whom Allah guides is the guided one; and those whom He lets go astray, you will never find for them any helpers other than Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:98: That is their punishment, because they rejected Our signs and said, “Is it that once we are reduced to bones and dust, is it then that we shall be raised, created anew?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:99: Have they not seen that Allah who has created the heavens and the earth has the power to create them as they were? He has appointed a time for them in which there is no doubt.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:100: Say, “If you were to own the treasures of my Lord’s blessing, you would certainly hold them back, lest it should be spent.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:101: Surely we gave Mūsā nine clear signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:102: He (Mūsā) said, “You know well that these (signs) are sent down by none but by the Lord of the heavens and the earth as eye-openers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:103: Then he (Pharaoh) tried to harass them to drive them out of the land, so We drowned him and those with him altogether,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:104: and thereafter We said to the children of Isrā’īl, “Live in the land.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:105: With truth We have sent it (the Qur’ān) down and with truth it descended, and We did not send you but as a bearer of good tidings and as a warner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:106: We have divided the Qur’ān in portions, so that you may recite it to the people gradually, and We have revealed it little by little.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:107: Say, “Believe in it or do not believe in it; when it is recited to those who were given knowledge before it, they fall down on their faces in prostration
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:109: They fall down on their faces weeping, and it increases humbleness in their hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:110: Say, “Call (Him by the name of) Allah or Ar-RaHmān, in whichever way you call, His are the Best Names.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 17:111: Say, “Praise belongs to Allah who has neither had a son, nor is there any partner to Him in His kingdom, nor is anyone (needed) to protect Him from (any) weakness.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:1: Glory be to Him Who carried His servant by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque; the environs of which We have blessed, that We might show him some of Our signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:2: And We gave Moses the Scripture, and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:3: that they should not choose beside Me any guardian.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:4: [They were] descendants of those whom We carried with Noah.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:5: And We decreed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture: ‘You shall indeed work corruption in the land, twice and you shall indeed become great tyrants’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:6: So when the time for the first of the two
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:7: came, We roused against you servants of Ours of great might, who ransacked
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:8: habitations, and it was a promise fulfilled.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:9: Then We gave you back the turn, [to prevail] over them, and We aided you with children and wealth, and made you greater in number.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:10: ‘If you are virtuous, you are being virtuous to your own souls, and if you do evil, it is for them’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:11: comes, that they might ravage you, and that they might enter the Temple, just as they entered it, the first time, and that they might destroy all that they conquered, utterly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:12: It may be that your Lord will have mercy upon you, but if you revert, We
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:13: will revert; and We have made Hell a dungeon for the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:14: Truly this Qur’ān guides to that which is straightest and gives tidings to the believers who perform righteous deeds that there is a great reward for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:15: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have prepared for them a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:16: And man prays for ill as [avidly as] he prays for good.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:17: And We made the night and the day two signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:18: And We have attached every person’s omen upon his neck and We shall bring forth for him, on the Day of Resurrection, a book which he will find wide open.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:19: ‘Read your book! This day your soul suffices as your own reckoner’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:20: Whoever is guided, is guided only to [the good of] his own soul, and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to its [his soul’s] detriment.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:21: And when We desire to destroy a town We command its affluent ones, but they fall into immorality therein, and so the Word is justified concerning it, and We destroy it utterly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:22: How many generations We have destroyed since Noah! And your Lord suffices as One Informed and Beholder of the sins of His servants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:23: Whoever desires the hasty world, We hasten for him therein whatever We will, for whom We please.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:24: And whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it with the necessary effort, being a believer — for such their effort will find favour.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:28: See how We have given preference to some of them over others.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:29: Do not set up another god besides God, or you will sit blameworthy, forsaken.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:30: And your Lord has decreed that you worship none save Him, and kindness to parents.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:31: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say: ‘My Lord, have mercy on them, just as they reared me when I was little’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:32: Your Lord knows best what is in your hearts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:33: And give the kinsman his due, and the needy and the traveller [as well]; and do not squander.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:34: Indeed squanderers are brothers of devils, and the Devil was ever ungrateful to his Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:35: But if you [have to] overlook them, seeking mercy from your Lord, [a mercy] which you expect [in the future], then speak to them gentle words.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:36: And do not keep your hand chained to your neck, nor open it completely, or you will sit blameworthy and denuded.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:37: Truly your Lord expands provision for whomever He will and He straitens.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:38: And do not slay your children, fearing penury.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:44: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with a right balance: that is better and fairer in return.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:45: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:46: And do not walk in the earth exultantly.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:55: The seven heavens and the earth and all that is therein proclaim His praise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:56: And when you recite the Qur’ān, We place between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a hidden barrier.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:57: And We place upon their hearts veils, lest they should understand it, and in their ears a deafness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:58: We know best what they listen to when they listen to you, and when they are in secret counsel, when the evildoers say: ‘You are only following a man bewitched’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:59: Look how they strike similitudes for you, and they go astray, and cannot find a way.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:81: And when distress befalls you at sea, those whom you [are wont to] invoke are no longer present, except Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:82: Do you feel secure that He will not cause a side of the earth to swallow you up, or unleash upon you a squall of pebbles? Then you will not find for yourselves any guardian.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 17:83: Or do you feel secure that He will not return you to it a second time and unleash upon you a shattering gale, and drown you for your ungratefulness? And then you will not find for yourselves any redresser of this against Us.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:2: And We gave Musa (Moses) the Book (the Torah) and made it guidance for the Children of Israel (and enjoined them:) ‘Do not take anyone other than Me as Guardian.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:3: (O) children of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Nuh (Noah)! Indeed, Nuh (Noah) was a highly grateful servant.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:4: And We categorically conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Book: ‘You shall make mischief twice in the land and employ a violent defiance (against obedience to Allah).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:5: So when the promised first time of the two came to pass, We brought upon you those of Our servants who were great warriors.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:6: Then We turned the victory over them to your favour and helped you with (affluence in) wealth and children and increased your numerical strength (as well).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:7: If you do good, you do it (only) for your own benefit, but if you do evil, you will sin against your own souls.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:8: It may well be that (after this) your Lord will have mercy on you, but if you revert to the same (rebellious and defiant behaviour), then We too will get back to the same (tormenting once again).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:9: Indeed, this Qur’an leads to that (destination) which is most right, and gives this good news to those believers who do righteous works, that for them is a mighty reward,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:10: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have prepared for them a painful punishment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:11: And (intolerant and anguished) man prays (sometimes) for evil as he prays for good (for himself).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:12: And We have made the night and the day two signs (of Our might).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:13: And We have slung every man’s record of deeds around his neck, and on the Day of Resurrection We shall bring forth (this) record, which he will find spread out (before him).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:14: (It will be said to him:) ‘Read your book (of deeds).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:15: Whoever adopts the path of guidance follows it to his own benefit, and whoever goes astray, then the evil consequences of his error also fall back on him alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:16: And when We resolve to destroy a town, We send (some) command to the rich and the affluent amongst them (so that the common man and the poor may make amends) but they act disobediently in (the town).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:17: And how many a community have We destroyed after Nuh (Noah)! And your Lord is Sufficient.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:18: Whoever longs for (quick recompense for his labour in the form of) worldly riches alone, We readily grant whatever We like to whoever We please, here in this world.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:19: And whoever longs for the Hereafter and toils for it befittingly and he is a believer (as well), it is they whose struggle will earn recognition.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:20: We extend help to all: those (ambitious of this world) as well as those (aspiring to the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:21: See how We have exalted some of them above the others! And surely, the Hereafter (as compared to this world) is far greater in degrees and in terms of superiority (as well).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:22: (O listener!) Do not set up another god along with Allah (lest) you should sit back condemned (and) forsaken.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:23: And your Lord has commanded you not to worship anyone other than Allah, and treat parents with benevolence.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:24: And always lower your wings of submissiveness and humility out of soft-heartedness for both of them, and keep supplicating (Allah): ‘O my Lord, have mercy on both of them as they brought me up in (my) childhood (with mercy and clemency).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:25: Your Lord is Well Aware of the (matters and intentions) that are in your hearts.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:26: And give to the kindred their rightful due, and also (give) to the needy and the wayfarer, and do not exhaust (your wealth) by expending wastefully.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:27: Surely, the spendthrifts are the brothers of Satan, and Satan is most ungrateful to his Lord.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:29: And neither keep your hand tied to your neck (giving nothing to anyone), nor stretch it wide open (giving away all) lest you should sit back, blamed (and) consumed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 17:30: Truly, your Lord opens up sustenance for whom He pleases and folds up (for whom He wills).
